name: lorry production, 28 metric ton | lorry, 28 metric ton | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/2400/documentation

Based on "lorry production, 28 metric ton, RER2002". Material consumption values refer to the production of one average lorry in the referring weight class  (net weight 10200t). Total Kilometric performance: 5.40E+05. Interventions for manufacturing processes of vehicles are independent of weight class. The disposal of lorry is included too.

The dataset starts with the material used for the production of the lorry.

The inventory includes processes of  material, energy and water use in vehicle manufacturing (final assembly, engine production and manufacturing of metal parts). Rail and road transport of materials is accounted for. Plant infrastructure is included, addressing issues such as land use, building, road and parking construction. Vehicle disposal is as well included.
category: C:Manufacturing/29:Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers/291:Manufacture of motor vehicles/2910:Manufacture of motor vehicles

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The material consumption represents a current vehicle FH. Data has been adjusted for 28 t vehicle.The data for vehicle production are representative for lorry production of one German company with an environmental management system. The data includes the final assembly (2000), engine production (2002) and the manufacturing of metal parts (2002).;References:;Volvo Truck Corporation (2004) Environmental product declaration: Volvo 8500 Low-Entry. Download of March from http://www.volvo.com/bus/global/en-gb/volvogroup/core+values/environment/downloads.htm.;MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) Umwelterklärung 1999. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München;MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München;Doka G. (2003) Life Cycle Inventories of Waste Treatment Services. Final report ecoinvent 2000 No. 13. EMPA St. Gallen, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Duebendorf, CH, Online-Version under: www.ecoinvent.ch.;Frischknecht R. and Jungbluth N. (2003) Code of Practice. Final report ecoinvent 2000 No. 2. ESU-services, Uster, Swiss Centre for Life Cycle Inventories, Duebendorf, CH, Online-Version under: www.ecoinvent.ch.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from "lorry production, 28 metric ton, RER2002". Vehicle manufacturing data are taken from one production site in  Germany.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology, environmental issues have been addressed in the past.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Data from one production site in Germany is used as an first estimate for Europe This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography RER. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Manufacturing data is taken from an environmental report of one production site. Additional data was generated via oral communcation.

exchanges.description: EcoSpold01Location=RER

flow.name: lorry, 28 metric ton
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/29:Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers/291:Manufacture of motor vehicles/2910:Manufacture of motor vehicles

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Literature value. Diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is modeled as building machine. Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002). The data is available for various manufacturing sites performing different tasks in the manufacturing chain. The total value used in this study comprises stamping processes, metal part and wiring harness  manufacturing, engine production and testing as well as the final assembly.

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Based on the diesel consumption for engine testing, direct environmental emissions to air are calculated, employing the emission profile of a lorry 28t empty. Is assumed that diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is modeled as building machine.Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002).

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER

Additional references:

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
Literature value. Diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is modeled as building machine. Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002). The data is available for various manufacturing sites performing different tasks in the manufacturing chain. The total value used in this study comprises stamping processes, metal part and wiring harness  manufacturing, engine production and testing as well as the final assembly.

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. Based on the diesel consumption for engine testing, direct environmental emissions to air are calculated, employing the emission profile of a lorry 28t empty. Is assumed that diesel is used for engine testing and the operation of fork-lifters. The latter is modeled as building machine.Energy expenditures for stationary combustion processes are available from environmental reports of a German lorry manufacturer MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2000) and MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002).

Additional references:

MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG (2002) Umwelterklärung 2002. MAN Nutzfahrzeuge AG, München.
